This is a quick post to introduce myself and write a few lines about the intentions behind this blog.

I am a Front-end developer and designer living in Lausanne, Switzerland. My background is design-focused as I have a BA in Visual Communication. My coding skills come from self-learning.

These past years I have been at an agency and grew more and more interest in the Front-end development scene. It quickly became clear to me that shooting out mocks and wireframes wasn't enough for my taste. I like to actually build the products that I design and code is now my tool of preference when it comes to creating a product.

Currently I'm mostly focused on finding a new role as a UX Enginner. Aside from that I'm tackling fun JAMstack stuff and getting more involved in the open source space.

With this blog I want to share more! Writing is a great way to teach, learn and get involved with the community. Talking about where coding needs opinions, focus on UX and usability Design point of viewcase studies of personal projects

That's it for now. If you want to get some smaller updates, you can follow me on Twitter.

Outside of the tech domain, I usually try to spend my time away from screens: I draw, play music, hike and enjoy some sports.
